Class TrapBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • TrapBox
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class TrapBox
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.WindowListener
    Version:
    5.0, June 8, 2014 This program will create the 'trap box'. This trap box will randomly choose a question out of the 100 question database and will allow the player to answer the question. If the player answers correctly, this program will return 'true'. If the player answers incorrectly, the program will return 'false'.

    Variable Dictionary
    Name Type Purpose
    d JDialog Gives program access to variables and methods within JDialog - for creating the trap box pop-up screen.
    questions String [][] A string array that will store the questions and their respective answers.
    boolean correct This variable contains the information concerning whether or not the user answered the latest question correctly or not.

    Author:
    Eric Tseng
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrapBox

        public TrapBox(Main frame)
        This is the class constructor. It sets the Main frame as it's frame and runs the method that obtains the questions and answers from the .txt file.

        Loops and Conditions
        if (file.exists()) The purpose of this structure is to check if the cheat file exists or not.
        try {} catch (IOEx... The purpose of this structure is to make sure the program does not crash due to an IOException or a NumberFormatException.
        if (in.readLine... The purpose of this structure is to check if the cheats have been enabled.

        Parameters:
        e - Variable associated to portion of code that prevents program from crashing due to an IOException.
        e - Variable associated to portion of code that prevents program from crashing due to a NumberFormatException.
        frame - Gives program access to Main frame.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the cheat file was not properly read or does not exist.
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - If the value entered in for 'chance' is non-numerical.

    • Method Detail

      • getData

        public void getData()
        The purpose of this method is to get the questions and their respective answers from the corresponding .txt file. (100 questions)

        Loops & Conditions
        try{}catch(IOException...) Purpose is to allow program to read in questions and answers from .txt file without risking a crash.
        for (int x...) This loop is used to read in all questions and answers from the .txt file into a 2D string array.

        Parameters:
        input - Variable used to read out data (questions & answers) from the .txt file.
        x - Loop variable used as a counter.
        ioe - Variable that prevents program from crashing due to an IOException.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file does not exist.

      • createTrap

        public int createTrap()
        The purpose of this method is to generate the trap box and the features surrounding the trap box. (Basically, every time the player moves, there's a 25% chance there will be a trap and if there is a trap, the question obtained will be randomly selected from the list of 100 questions.) Finally, this method will also return true or false based on whether or not the player answered the most recent question correctly or not.

        Loops and Conditions
        if (Math.random() < 0.25) This if structure makes sure that the trap will only appear 25% of the time.

        Parameters:
        r - This variable is used to get a random number between 1 and 100, and will become the index value of the question & answer that will be selected.
        Returns:
        True if player answered correctly and false if they did not.

      • box

        public void box(java.lang.String question)
        Purpose of this method is to generate the pop up box that contains the question, user input text box, and button that allows them to confirm that they have answered.
        Parameters:
        question - This variable stores the question.
        d - This variable gives the method access to the methods and variables of JDialog, allowing method to create the pop up window.
        answerButton - This variable is associated to the button that allows the user to confirm their answer. (Labelled "Answer".)
        inputField - This variable is associated to the text field that allows the user to put their solution in.
        questionL - This variable is used to create a JLabel with the desired question on it in order to place it on the window.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        The purpose of this method is to check what the user has inputted and to perform the corresponding action based on that user action.

        Loops and Conditions
        if (inputField...(cheat)) Purpose of this structure is to check if the user has entered the cheat code or not.
        if (!inputField.getText()...("")) Purpose of this structure is to make sure the user has not left their answer blank.

        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - This variable gives the method the ability to check what the user has entered - the ability to 'listen'.
